PetuniaQ1.Text: My gosh! I just can't believe it! "My beautiful flowers dead like cattle!" She hasn't yet noticed your presence

PetuniaQ2.Text: The woman proceeded to turn around "My gosh dear, don't sneak up on me like that. I might have a heart attack!" She exclaimed dramatically. "My name is Petunia, this is my garden or was more accurately..."

Options.OptionText: I'm sure it could still be salvaged
Looks like you should have taken a better care of it.
Flowers aren't worth that kind of effort

PetuniaQ4.Text:
That's quite true, but now that you're here I have an idea!" Petunia beams, a devious smile adoring her wrinkled face. "Destroy that dam for me sweetie, it would make my world so much easier" 
>"What? Why would I do that?" 
>"I heard about you, you're that fellow that is trying to fix this filthy world. Well I offer a deal. You destroy that dam and I will dedicate this garden to growing vegies and fruits that anyone may come pick out. So what do you say?"

PetuniaQ5.Text: Petunia looked up at you with anticipation 'Yes dear? Is it done?'

MerchantQ1.Text:
An energetic man in a purple suit and a large top hat spots you
'Welcome welcome! What may I interest you in today?'

MerchantQ2.Text: 'Feel free to check out anything you want! I'll be right over here if you need anything."glancing over the selection of items the first thing that caught your attention was the ridiculous price under each and every item.

Options.OptionText: This is absurd I DEMAND to speak to your manager!

MerchantQ3.Text:
"My apologies, I'm aware that it's expensive but there's nothing I can do about it."
"Resources have been getting scarce which sky rocketed inflation on even the most mundane items", - he bows apologetically.

MerchantQ4.Text:
"I tried talking to my [Boss] about maybe producing our own renewable items, but he seems dead-set on importing all our products. It seems he gave up on making anything with what little we have", the merchant answered, dejected.
"But maybe you could talk some sense into him?"

MerchantQ5.Text: 'Did you talk to the Boss yet?' The merchant inquired.

MerchantQ6.Text: 'Did you talk to Boss yet?', the merchant inquired.

BossQ1.Text:
Entering the room in the back you are greeted with the sight of an older gentleman sitting in a very comfortable chair:
"Yes, what is it?"
You should be careful with what you say from now on.

Options.OptionText: Hi, I'd like to talk to you about a solution for your business.
You're overcharging your customers! Just get cheaper materials!

BossQ2.Text:
"Oh god not this again.", the old man sighed heavily.
"Listen I'm guessing you're here because of the prices and I'm certain you already heard from my employee that there's nothing we can do, so I suggest you leave."

Options.OptionText: Do you truly think this kind of attitude is sustainable? Eventually you'll lose all your customers
This is outrageous just listen to me!
I promise what I have in mind will benefit you.

BossSomeCorrect.Text:
You make some interesting points... Alright how about this, I'll consider it if you give me some kind of... Insurance.
Well, at least he's listening, what now?

WoodworkersQ1.Text:
An old rugged person acknowledges you:
"Hey! Are you another worker they sent over here? We have a lot of work to do and we won't be able to complete more bridges without you. Imagine reaching Dunes of Raghar from here!"

Options.OptionText: Sure, tell me more and I'll help you
I am not a worker, I was just passing by. What is going on?

WoodworkersQ2-1.Text: "We want to be able to reach every part of the main land from here; we'll get to trade quicker!"

WoodworkersQ2-2.Text: "We want to be able to reach every part of the main land from here, did you now decide to help us?"

Options.OptionText: For sure, I'll help you with the bridges

HutsQ1-1.Text:
You decide to walk to the huts. You see tired people, brittle huts and one of those people approach you.
She seems very angry and yells at you:
"Go away, we don't need more people here, we barely have resources to build our own houses.
Leave! Vanish! Get lost!"

Options.OptionText: I'm sorry, I just came to ask about what happened

HutsQ1-2.Text:
You return to the huts. The same tired lady approaches you...
"So, you changed your mind..."
"Do you now know what happened?"

Options.OptionText: Yes, I want to know what happened

HutsQ2.Text: "You probably noticed our bleak looking island, we just want to live here, but with all of the constructions going on, we don't have people or materials to improve our houses."

Options.OptionText: Is there any way I could help?

HutsQ3.Text:
"There is, if the wood they're using for the bridges could be used to repair our homes, that'd improve all of our lives."
"But for that we'd need to stop the woodworkers or disassemble some bridges, we don't need that many to live well."
